intro: Stigmaphyllon diversifolium var. sericeum, commonly known as the silky stigmaphyllon, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, silvery-hairy leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that are often clustered in terminal inflorescences. This species is typically found in moist, shaded environments within tropical and subtropical regions.
